revised_title: The Mechanism of Polyneuronal Innervation Elimination in Developing Muscle
tldr: The article examines the establishment and subsequent elimination of polyneuronal innervation in developing muscle, focusing on the role of interactions between terminals. The author proposes a theoretical model in which terminals compete for resources, leading to the elimination of excess innervation and the formation of adult muscle configurations with a single axon per muscle fiber.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
